roleset.name: to choose as more desirable
roleset.note: PREFER-V NOTES: Corresponds to VN classes want-32.1-1-1 and admire-31.2 (from prefer.01-v)
PREFERENCE-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to perfer.01. Prefer.01 is a member of VN classes want-32.1-1-1 and admire-31.2.Framed by Katie. (from preference.01-n)

example.name: prefer-v: transitive
example.text: Although manufacturers often are quick [*-1] to call for lower interest rates , 60 % of the executives said [0]they would prefer that the Fed keep inflation-fighting as its top priority even if that means higher rates .
example.arg: that the Fed keep inflation-fighting as its top priority even if that means higher rates

example.name: prefer-v: passive
example.text: [The sales-tax plan]-239 was preferred [*-239]over an alternative that [*T*-277] would have boosted the state gasoline tax .
example.arg: over an alternative that [*T*-277] would have boosted the state gasoline tax

example.name: prefer-v: all arguments
example.text: Sulzer preferred him to financier Tito Tettamanti , whose secretive raid on the company 's stock [*T*-1] had led to a bitter battle .
example.arg: to financier Tito Tettamanti , whose secretive raid on the company 's stock [*T*-1] had led to a bitter battle

roleset.name: tending to be preferred
roleset.note: PREFERABLE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia for unification as an alias file. (from preferable.01-j)

roleset.name: giving/receiving preference
roleset.note: PREFERENTIAL-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from preferential.01-j)

example.name: preferential-j
example.text: Situations where-1 slow motor unit (SMU) recruitment is preferential to fast motor unit (FMU) recruitment *-1 can be utilised in retraining strategies.
